title.narrative: LFSP - APN - Mashonaland - ENTERPRIZE Ensuring Nutrition, Transforming and Empowering Rural Farmers and Promoting Resilience in Zimbabwe

description.narrative:
This is a subgrant from a consortium in which World Vision is the lead and where the FAO (managing DFID funds) is the source donor.
World Vision, Mercy Corps, Farmers Association of Community Self-Help Investment Group (FACHIG) and ICRISAT have partnered to form a consortium proposing to work in Mashonaland Central. The proposed project, named ‘Ensuring Nutrition, Transforming and Empowering Rural Farmers and Promoting Resilience in Zimbabwe (ENTERPRIZE)’, will work with a network of stakeholders to improve the food and nutrition security of at least 25,500 farmer households in Mt. Darwin and Guruve.
The overarching strategy of ENTERPRIZE is to mobilise and support multi-stakeholder partnerships and community-based groups, grow local capacity, and work within existing systems to stimulate demand for and support equitable access to private and public products and services which contribute to lasting improvements in the productivity, profitability, resilience and nutrition of small holder farmers. Underpinning the entire strategy is intensive analysis and action on gender at farm household, farm organization, and farm and market system levels.

• Women and men farmers better able to manage farm enterprises and in climate resilient ways • Increased demand, production and consumption of diverse nutritious foods • Commercial markets, traders and processors better able to respond to women and men farmers’ needs. • Evidence generated and communicated effectively to influence policies and investments (public and private)

participating-org.narrative: Farmers Association of Community Self-Help Investment Groups (FACHIG)
Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)
International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT)
